intro: Spermacoce keyensis, commonly known as the Key morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Florida Keys. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Spermacoce keyensis typically grows in wetlands and coastal areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of ecological study.
